page.title: 09WORKINGTON'S COASTLINE
page.content: The{coastline}from Workington to Harrington has suffered for over 100 years from the{tipping of waste {materials}mainly from the iron and steel industry.As a result of constant tipping the{slag bank}has forced the coastline out to sea.Also there are sewage outlets from both{industrial {and domestic users. The coastline is made up of shillies,boulders and waste materials.It does not attract many visitors due to the sewage etc.{Mobet have plans to reshape the coastline and try and get{tourists}to visit the area.They are hoping to introduce sand on the shore and shops by the coastline. {Wave action}has caused much{erosion to the coastline.A section of wall has been built to protect the{steel {complex.
